attributes.action: Secretary State for Transport to intervene to resolve chaos of new GTR timetable
attributes.background: The new Govia Thameslink timetable has caused untold misery for commuters and left front line railway staff to bear the brunt of angry & frustrated commuters as hundreds of services are cancelled or changed. The Secretary of State must intervene & hold this company to account

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not exactly sure what you want the Secretary of State for Transport to do. In particular we're not sure what you mean by "intervene and hold this company to account". 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

If you want the Government to remove Govia Thameslink Railway's contract, you may wish to sign this petition instead: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/220440 

If you want the previous time table to be reinstated, you may wish to sign this petition instead: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/220566 

You may be interested to know that the Secretary of State for Transport made a statement about this issue on Monday 4 June and MPs asked questions about it. 

You can read the statement here: https://hansard.parliament.uk/commons/2018-06-04/debates/8053C64D-817B-4041-BB61-9C445FDC599E/RailTimetabling 

You can watch/ listen to the statement here: https://parliamentlive.tv/event/index/b00320b1-dbf7-4fdc-b51c-db3e8a5f200b?in=17:01:27
